index.title: Home | teksiks.ee
index.heroDescription: Automated speech transcription service for Estonian speech and a user interface for transcription editing.
index.tekstiksIntro: is a public speech recognition service of TalTech's Laboratory of Language Technology. The system demonstrates technologies and models developed in this lab. These currently achieve state-of-the-art Estonian speech recognition results, even compared to commercial alternatives. The system is fully automated and can process multiple files in parallel. There can be a queue and delays, especially during business hours. The average processing time is about half of the recording's length.
index.tekstiksIntroRemark: Coming soon: real-time progress and expected time of completion information
index.step1: 1. Upload a speech recording in Estonian
index.step1Desc: Most of the popular audio and video formats are supported. Max size limit is 500MB
index.step2: 2. Wait for the speech recognition to complete.
index.step2Desc: The system trained using machine learning methods will search for Estonian speech segments and tries to differentiate multiple speakers. Then it will transcribe the speech segments into text and finally will add punctuation. Many Estonain celebrities and radio personalities can be identified by name as well.
index.step3Desc: The editing of the transcription is interactive. The integrated audio player and the text are in sync. The currently playing word in coloured to simplify the manual editing.
index.step4Desc: Download the transcription, currently the DOCX format is supported.
index.rec1: The speech in the audio file should be of the best possible quality, i.e. recorded with a microphone near the mouth in a noise-free environment. The audio file should be at least 16-bit encoded and 16 KHz in frequency, preferably in WAV format.
index.rec2: As the maximum file size that can be uploaded is 500 MB, longer WAV files can be encoded in mp3 or ogg format, but it is recommended that you use at least 128 kbit encoding. Converting the stereo format to mono also saves volume (it is done anyway during detection).
index.rec3: The system does not work well with audio files longer than two hours. With such files, recognition may fail and the recognition result will not be returned. We recommend splitting long files first.
index.rec4: Due to limited resource of the recognition server, please do not upload more than 10 recordings per day. Otherwise, there will be a long queue in the system for all users. If you need to transcribe a large number of files (eg an entire audio archive), please contact us.
index.citing1: If you use this system for research, please refer to the article below in your publications (available at
index.osDesc: is based on freeware solutions that are easy to set up yourself. The recognition system can also be run from inside a Docker container (recommended).
index.osASR: Speech recognition system. It works as a step-by-step process that can be observed. Executable from the command line.
index.osServer: A web server solution that allows you to create a simple API through which to use speech recognition. Also supports returning of real-time processing progress information.
index.finnish1: Finnish speech recognition has been developed in co-operation with Finnish Language Bank and Aalto University. Speech recordings are processed by a service hosted by Finnish Language Bank.

terms.title: Terms of Use | tekstiks.ee
terms.h1: Terms of use of the service
terms.terms1: Tekstiks.ee is a publicly available service where you can use speech recognition software created by the Language Technology Laboratory of the Institute of Software Science, of Tallinn University of Technology. The speech recognition software is open source and can be deployed locally (on-premise).
terms.terms2: When using speech recognition in Finnish, the audio recording and its file name are transferred in an unpersonalized form to the speech recognition service of the Language Bank of Finland. Their service is a data processor but does not store data long-term.
terms.terms3: To use the service, it is necessary to create an account. The account is only used to allow later access to the audio and video recordings you upload. It also helps to protect the textual transcription produced as a result of speech recognition and the user's privacy.
terms.terms4: Data is stored on servers managed by Tallinn University of Technology. These are located in Estonia. The user has the freedom to delete uploaded files, as a result of which these are permanently deleted together with the associated textual transcriptions.
terms.terms5: The system does not store more personal data about the user than the e-mail address and name requested during registration. At the moment, there are no other services that monitor user behavior. The service provider is free to use them, in this case by asking for additional consent.
terms.terms6: The data uploaded to the system may be used to improve the system during troubleshooting. Call recordings are not used together with user identification data.
terms.validFrom: Terms of use are valid from 23.10.2022
